body.name: ThreeBulls PWM Fan Hub , PC CPU Cooling 4 PIN/3PIN Power Cable Hub Splitter Adapter Sleeved Case for 12V Desktop Computer Cooler Fans 1 to 5 Way (15.7 Inch)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 13 hrs 6 mins
features: Excellent 4-pin PWM 1 to 5 splitter fan power supply extension cable for PC computer motherboard fans, make you easier diy PC computer case.
Widely Compatible: The cable is one 4-pin female connector to 4-pin male connector, support 4-pin and 3-pin fans cable, the fan power cable compatible with 4 pin and 3 pin PC case fans.
Easy to plug, the fan extension cable offers greater flexibility between Motherboard and CPU cooling fans.
Black sleeved nylon braided cable, more durable and make the inside of pc case looks more clean & tidy.
Package contents: 1 black 15.7 inch 1-to-5 splitter fan power supply extension cables, male to female connector plug.
body.description: Specification: Product Name: 1 to 5 Black Sleeved PWM fan Extension Cable Connector Type: 4 pin Length: 27cm/10.6inch Function: help protect your PC from overheating. The cable is one 4-pin female connector to 4-pin male connector, suits for CPU and PC 4-Pin / 3-Pincase fan. Package Content: 1 Pack 1 to 5 PWM Fan Extnesion Cable .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Set to DC mode in BIOS, Not PWM.
reviews.reviewText: It's got the 4-pin PWM connector, but it's not PWM, it's DC. Works great with case fans where you just want them to all spin at the same speed.Where ever you plug it into the motherboard, just set the fan type to DC mode in BIOS.For Windows folk, you can use the FanControl software to either have the fans speed at a steady rate or set it to change based on a temperature source. I've got mine set to a steady 55% - and the system keeps cool and the fans are inaudible. Of course, depending on the fans you are using YMMV.Either way - very good result for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars THIS THING RULES
reviews.reviewText: I was attempting to install THREE NEW FANS (after removing two) and suddenly realized that I had only TWO 4-PIN PWM's (CHA_FAN1 & CHA_FAN2) on my motherboard. I needed four!!! I quickly searched for PWM SPLITTERS on Amazon and was relieved to find THIS SPLITTER which has FIVE 4-PIN PWM's (1 CPU & 4 FAN). I did not require the ONE CPU 4-PIN, but I needed exactly FOUR FAN 4-PIN. I plugged the splitter into CHA_FAN1 and, after some degree of cable managing, I peeled the paper off of the bottom and stuck it comfortably to the bottom of the case.Altogether I'm glad they made this. It works perfectly for what I need it for.Salutations.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very nice for adding extra pc fans, well built and not cheaply made either.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Does the job
reviews.reviewText: This fan splitter adequately fulfills its purpose of allowing multiple fans to be connected to a single fan header. It effectively enables the distribution of power and control signals, simplifying the setup of your cooling system. While it may not have any standout features, it reliably performs its intended function as a fan splitter.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: So far I've ordered 2 of these. They work great. I have no complaints. While they are somewhat fragile, they surpassed my expectations for the price. I've seen comments about them igniting, but that isn't the fault of the product. Please read the specs on your motherboard and make sure it has the proper bridge. I also only go 3 fans per splitter to be on the safe side. I'm currently running 6 RGB fans using 2 splitters and have had no issues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars All of my fans work :D
reviews.reviewText: I remember installing these back when I first built my PC, haven't had problems since, fans still work nicely.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Used it to power my 360mm radiator and 120mm fans, works great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It works wonderfully and gets the job done.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. It works as intended and runs great. If you are looking into this as a way to power a pump on an AIO, I HIGHLY suggest you do not buy or use this product for that. That being said, the adapter itself has 5 headers, allowing you to power 5 fans off 1 MB header. I personally would not recommend running more than 3-4 fans off this product, especially if you're new to building PC's. Note that the first header labeled " CPU " must be the first fan position when using this product. After the first 3 headers, the 4th and 5th will supply power, but will not run your fans at full power. If you have an experience like others on in the reviews of the product catching fire or so called " exploding " then you are either running too much power to the product or your MB cannot supply 5 fans on the product. As for the wiring itself, it's very well sleeved and protected. It's length however is rather short so definitely plan ahead on your fan placements and header locations on your motherboard. The sleeve on this product is very difficult to bend and manipulate, I suggest you only bend the cable at areas that are not directly near the header or the actual board itself, it felt fragile. I would recommend this product to anyone intending to add more than 5-10 fans within their build, just make sure to check your MB support.

It arrived early. Order placed Oct. 28, arrived Oct 31. It wasn’t supposed to arrive until Nov. 3rd, so I’m quite happy about that.I love the quality. I love the braded cable. I also hadn’t realized it would have a sticker on the back to hold it in place, if and when I decide on a good permanent location. That's a nice touch.It’s solid, clearly marked, and works exactly as I had hoped it would. I am using it to control the fans in my AIO radiator and after inspecting it thoroughly, I feel confident I have made a good decision, and it can be relied on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Great value, does exactly what it says.
reviews.reviewText: Works perfectly, great value for the money. Seems well made, and even includes a 3m pad to stick it in.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speed of CPU is shown, but speed of PWM fan conncted to hub is not shown
reviews.reviewText: Connected one end to the cpu header , plug the cpu fan on the hub to cpu header, and fan on the other header of the hub , in bios it shows the cpu fan speed but speed of other fan (PWM) connected to the hub are not shown , still they are spinning.
It works, and has a sticker in the back so it doesn't dangle. Glad i didnt pay what some of these people are charging for something so simple…

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I used this for my first ever PC build, and I was in need because I was one fan header short on my motherboard so I thought I would give this product a go.It is very easy to set up, just plug in and its ready to go, the sticker on the back is a nice addition, you can stick it on the inside of your PC case to keep it tidy and organised.Overall, very happy with this product
